timeline.message: Add optimization to ASREGS so it replaces STORE on lists containing only register numbers by POPRs

timeline.bodyText: What happens if you initially had 1 2 3 [ 1 2 2 ] STORE? It seems that register 2 will end up with value 2 instead of 3.
timeline.author: hbs

replies.bodyText:
Good question, I didn't think about this case.
Turns out
  1 2 3 [ 1 2 2 ] STORE
  2 LOAD

Leaves 2 on the stack as STORE iterates through the array backwards poping and storing. So the behavior is the same with or without ASREGS.
However there is an other bug, I'm investigating.
replies.author: ftence

replies.bodyText: I think we should consider fixing STORE in the process, 1 2 3 [ 1 2 2 ] STORE should really leave 3 in register 2, at least that is what would be expected.
replies.author: hbs

timeline.message: Fix STORE on a list with duplicate symbols
More optimizations for ASREGS to convert STORE/CSTORE/LOAD on LONG to equivalent register function

timeline.bodyText: Use get(n) in the loop then a dropn instead of calling popn which will allocate a new array.
timeline.author: hbs

timeline.bodyText: Use a static set of maps instead of per call maps.
timeline.author: hbs

timeline.message: Use get and dropn instead of popn
Use static instance for DROP and register functions, fix CPOPR, comments
